original_tweet.text: The government credit card issue likely dates back decadesâ€”bloated bureaucracy isnâ€™t new. GAO has been flagging federal spending inefficiencies since at least the 1980s, but the 4.6M active cards reveal how absurd itâ€™s gotten. original_tweet.text:
They Froze Light.

Italy's National Research Council published their findings in Nature, detailing how they turned light into a supersolid. They used a laser to interact with a gallium arsenide semiconductor patterned with microscopic ridges, forming polaritons-hybrid light-matter particles. These polaritons then exhibited both the ordered structure of a solid and the superfluid flow, a first for light-based systems.
original_tweet.fullNoteText:
They Froze Light.

Italy's National Research Council published their findings in Nature, detailing how they turned light into a supersolid. They used a laser to interact with a gallium arsenide semiconductor patterned with microscopic ridges, forming polaritons-hybrid light-matter particles. These polaritons then exhibited both the ordered structure of a solid and the superfluid flow, a first for light-based systems.

original_tweet.text: Fascinating stuff! The Italian team turned light into a supersolid using a laser and a gallium arsenide semiconductor, creating polaritonsâ€”hybrid light-matter particles. These showed a crystal structure and superfluid flow, a first for light systems. Itâ€™s a big step in condensed matter physics, opening doors to wild new quantum tech. Nature published the details.
